meanings.definition: To preserve or cherish as sacred or precious.
meanings.sent1: The family enshrined the old photo in a special frame.
meanings.sent2: The tradition of enshrining memories in scrapbooks is common.
meanings.sent3: The cat enshrined its favorite toy by hiding it under the bed.
meanings.sent4: Her love for literature was enshrined in her personal library.
meanings.sent5: The values of honesty and kindness were enshrined in the community's beliefs.

meanings.definition: To enclose in or as if in a shrine.
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifact was enshrined in a glass display case.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, important relics are enshrined in temples.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child enshrined his favorite toy in a makeshift fort.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood were enshrined in the old family home.
meanings.sent5: The precious gem was enshrined in a beautiful jewelry box.

meanings.sent1: The castle walls enshrined the kingdom from invaders.
meanings.sent2: Parents enshrine the safety of their children above all else.
meanings.sent3: The password enshrined the privacy of the personal files.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse enshrined the sailors from the dangers of the rocky coast.
meanings.sent5: The treaty enshrined the rights of all citizens in the land.
